intro: Cryptantha clevelandii, commonly known as Cleveland's cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
